NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Exploration and Prices or the cell corresponding to Gas and Prices?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Gas} and {Prices} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Renewables and Prices or the cell corresponding to Oil and Reliability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Renewables} and {Prices} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Gas and Consumption or the cell corresponding to Waste Management and Prices?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Gas} and {Consumption} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Distribution and Storage or the cell corresponding to Distribution and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Distribution} and {Storage} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.16 to 0.22?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Water, Policy), (Water, Prices), (Waste Management, Production), (Oil, Reliability), (Transmission, Reliability), (Waste Management, Reliability), (Coal, Storage), (Distribution, Storage), (Gas, Storage), (Transmission, Storage), (Waste Management, Storage), (Exploration, Technology), (Nuclear, Technology), (Oil, Technology)}.
